flawed_nl_solution:
In the first half of the year, the company constructed 3/5*2000 = <<3/5*2000=10000/3>>10000/3 units.
The number of units remaining to be built after the company built 10000/3 units in the first half of the year is 2000-10000/3 = <<2000-10000/3=-4000/3>>-4000/3
By October, the company built an additional 300 units, thus remaining with -4000/3-300 = <<-4000/3-300=-4900/3>>-4900/3 units to be built.
#### -4900/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 10000/3. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
